availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ephraim L. Van Winkle (Kentucky Sec. State)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, attorney and secretary of state. Wayne County, Kentucky, native. Attended Monticello Academy. Graduated from the Louisville School of Law in 1850. Married to Ellen E. Van Winkle. Father of Milton E Van Winkle, Mary E Van Winkle, Lucy A Van Winkle, and Betty Van Winkle. Member of the Kentucky House of Representative from Wayne County, Kentucky, in 1855. Commonwealth's Attorney for the sixth district in 1856. State elector for Constitution Union Party candidate John Bell in 1860. Secretary of State of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from September 1863 to May 1866.

bibl.p: "Ephraim Van Winkle." Office of the Kentucky Secretary of State. Accessed March 08, 2017. (http://apps.sos.ky.gov/secdesk/sosinfo/default.aspx?id=39); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 7; U.S., Civil War Draft Registrations Records, 1863-1865 (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865).
